titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Henry Heald Speeches Collection
1952-1956
MC 50
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Claire Wolford.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-07-29T11:19-0400

did.unittitle: Henry Heald Speeches
did.abstract: The Henry Heald Speeches Collection contains numerous addresses, interviews, and commencement speeches made by Henry T. Heald between 1952 and 1956, while he was Chancellor of NYU.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
New York University Archives Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012 Phone: (212) 998-2646 Fax: (212) 995-4225 E-mail: university-archives@nyu.edu

arrangement.head: Arrangment
arrangement.p: This collection is comprised of 107 folders organized chronologically into 3 boxes.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Henry Townley Heald was born on November 8, 1904 in Lincoln Nebraska. He obtained his Bachelors in 1923 from Washington State University and went on to get his Masters degree in Civil Engineering from the University of Illinois. He went on to work at the Illinois Institute of Technology, eventually becoming President in 1938. Following his tenure there he came the Chancellor of NYU in 1950 where he helped strengthen the institution and became an outspoken proponent for evaluating and restructuring higher education with an outlook towards accessibility for all. In 1956, Heald became the President of the Ford Foundation where he channeled the Foundation's resources into philanthropic pursuits. During his ten years as President, the Ford Foundation gave 1.75 billion towards philanthropic purposes and established programs for the arts, the physical sciences, and engineering. Henry T. Heald died on November 23, 1975 in Winter Park, Florida.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Henry Heald Speeches Collection; MC 50; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Henry Heald Speeches Collection contains over 100 separate speeches and addresses made by Henry T. Heald, all from between 1952 and 1956, when he was Chancellor at New York University. Included are addresses on the importance of higher education, the future of NYU, and the connection between education and freedom.
